queries: [WEB] astronomy light curve smoothing tools github

tools.name: symdim
tools.one_line_profile: Equation manipulation with dimensional analysis using SymPy and Astropy
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that integrates SymPy and Astropy.units to perform equation manipulation while maintaining and checking dimensional analysis, useful for physics and astronomy calculations.

tools.name: POTPyRI
tools.one_line_profile: Data reduction pipeline for imaging from large aperture telescopes
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based data reduction pipeline designed for processing imaging data from large aperture telescopes, facilitating the analysis of astronomical transients.

tools.name: zodipy
tools.one_line_profile: Zodiacal light simulations for astronomy
tools.detailed_description: An Astropy-affiliated package for simulating zodiacal light emission, useful for planning observations and analyzing background noise in astronomical data.

tools.name: dkist
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for processing and interacting with DKIST solar telescope data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for obtaining, processing, and interacting with calibrated data from the Daniel K. Inouye Solar Telescope (DKIST).

tools.name: pgmuvi
tools.one_line_profile: Gaussian processes for inference on multi-wavelength light curves
tools.detailed_description: A Python package implementing Gaussian processes for inference on multi-wavelength light curves, specifically designed for astronomical time-domain analysis.

tools.name: KPF-Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Data reduction pipeline for Keck Planet Finder
tools.detailed_description: The data reduction pipeline for the Keck Planet Finder (KPF) instrument, handling the processing of spectroscopic data.

tools.name: allesfitter
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible inference of stars and exoplanets from photometric and radial velocity data
tools.detailed_description: A package for fitting photometric and radial velocity data, wrapping ellc, dynesty, emcee, and celerite to model light curves and RV signals for exoplanet science.

tools.name: Everest Framework
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for HL7v3 and CDA medical data structures
tools.detailed_description: A .NET framework designed to ease the creation, formatting, and transmission of HL7v3 and Clinical Document Architecture (CDA) structures for medical informatics and healthcare data exchange.

tools.name: jeverest
tools.one_line_profile: Java framework for HL7v3 medical data structures
tools.detailed_description: The Java implementation of the Everest Framework, facilitating the handling of HL7v3 structures for medical data interoperability.

tools.name: JetFit
tools.one_line_profile: Gamma-ray Burst Afterglow Light Curve Fitting Tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for fitting Gamma-ray Burst (GRB) afterglow light curves, aiding in the analysis of transient astronomical events.

tools.name: k2sc
tools.one_line_profile: K2 systematics correction using Gaussian processes
tools.detailed_description: A tool for correcting systematics in K2 (Kepler) light curves using Gaussian processes, improving the quality of photometric data for exoplanet detection and stellar astrophysics.

tools.name: TESS_Gaia_Light_Curve
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for TESS FFI light curve fitting and decontamination
tools.detailed_description: A workflow/pipeline for fitting TESS Full Frame Image (FFI) light curves with effective PSF modeling and decontaminating them using Gaia DR3 data.

tools.name: lunarsky
tools.one_line_profile: Astropy extension for lunar surface observation geometry
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that extends Astropy to describe observations and coordinate transformations from the surface of the Moon.

tools.name: eleanor
tools.one_line_profile: TESS Full Frame Image light curve extraction pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for downloading, analyzing, and visualizing data from the TESS Full Frame Images, specifically for extracting light curves.

tools.name: MoonPy
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for exoplanet and exomoon light curve analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive toolkit for downloading, detrending, visualizing, and fitting light curves for exoplanet and exomoon research.

tools.name: ASDF
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced Scientific Data Format library
tools.detailed_description: A next-generation interchange format for scientific data, providing a Python library for reading and writing ASDF files.

tools.name: asdf-astropy
tools.one_line_profile: ASDF serialization support for Astropy objects
tools.detailed_description: An extension library that provides the necessary tags and schemas to serialize Astropy objects (like coordinates, tables, and models) into ASDF format.

tools.name: Astropy
tools.one_line_profile: Core library for Astronomy and Astrophysics
tools.detailed_description: The core package for Astronomy in Python, providing common tools such as units, coordinates, FITS handling, and modeling.

tools.name: astropy-healpix
tools.one_line_profile: HEALPix pixelization for Astropy
tools.detailed_description: A BSD-licensed implementation of HEALPix (Hierarchical Equal Area isoLatitude Pixelization) for use with Astropy.

tools.name: astroquery
tools.one_line_profile: Access to online astronomical data services
tools.detailed_description: A package for querying and retrieving data from online astronomical archives and web services (e.g., SIMBAD, VizieR, MAST).

tools.name: astrowidgets
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter widgets for astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A set of Jupyter widgets for interactive visualization and analysis of astronomical data, leveraging the Astropy ecosystem.

tools.name: ccdproc
tools.one_line_profile: Optical/IR CCD data reduction toolkit
tools.detailed_description: An Astropy affiliated package for basic data reduction of CCD images, including bias/dark subtraction and flat fielding.

tools.name: photutils
tools.one_line_profile: Source detection and photometry tools
tools.detailed_description: An Astropy package for detecting sources on astronomical images and performing photometry (aperture and PSF).

tools.name: pyregion
tools.one_line_profile: DS9 region file parser
tools.detailed_description: A Python module to parse ds9 region files and display them on images using Matplotlib.

tools.name: PyVO
tools.one_line_profile: Virtual Observatory (VO) access library
tools.detailed_description: A package providing access to remote data and services of the Virtual Observatory (VO) using Python.

tools.name: regions
tools.one_line_profile: Astropy region handling package
tools.detailed_description: An in-development package for handling regions (spatial subsets) in Astropy, including defining, plotting, and masking.

tools.name: specreduce
tools.one_line_profile: Spectroscopic reduction tools
tools.detailed_description: A package for the reduction of spectroscopic observations from Optical and NIR instruments.

tools.name: specutils
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical spectroscopy utilities
tools.detailed_description: An Astropy coordinated package for representing, analyzing, and manipulating astronomical spectra.

tools.name: taufit
tools.one_line_profile: AGN light curve modeling with Celerite
tools.detailed_description: A tool for efficient AGN light curve modeling and parameter estimation using the Celerite Gaussian Process library.

tools.name: agnpy
tools.one_line_profile: Modelling jetted Active Galactic Nuclei radiative processes
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for modelling the radiative processes of jetted Active Galactic Nuclei (AGN).

tools.name: ASPIRED
tools.one_line_profile: Automated SpectroPhotometric Image REDuction pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for the automated reduction of spectrophotometric images, designed for rapid processing.

tools.name: celerite
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable 1D Gaussian Processes
tools.detailed_description: A library for fast and scalable Gaussian Process regression in one dimension, widely used for astronomical time series analysis.

tools.name: george
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and flexible Gaussian Process regression
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for Gaussian Process regression, designed for use in astronomy and other scientific fields.

tools.name: PhotoPipe
tools.one_line_profile: Automated reduction, photometry, and astrometry pipeline for RATIR and RIMAS data
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed for the automated reduction, photometry, and astrometry of imaging data from the RATIR and RIMAS instruments, facilitating the generation of light curves.

tools.name: Nova DSO Tracker
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time tracking and observability prediction for deep-sky objects
tools.detailed_description: An application for astrophotographers and observers to track deep-sky objects' altitude in real-time, predict observability, and integrate with Stellarium and SIMBAD databases.

tools.name: reducer
tools.one_line_profile: Friendly professional-level astronomical data reduction tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to simplify the process of astronomical data reduction and calibration, providing a user-friendly interface for processing imaging data.

tools.name: radbelt
tools.one_line_profile: Astropy-friendly wrapper for the AE-8/AP-8 Van Allen belt models
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper that provides an Astropy-compatible interface to the AE-8 and AP-8 models of the Van Allen radiation belts, useful for space science and mission planning.

tools.name: LATTE
tools.one_line_profile: Lightcurve Analysis Tool for Transiting Exoplanets
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed for the visual inspection and analysis of light curves from transiting exoplanet surveys, helping to identify false positives and validate candidates.

tools.name: michael
tools.one_line_profile: Estimator for robust spot rotation rates from TESS light curves
tools.detailed_description: A Python package to estimate robust stellar spot rotation rates from TESS Full Frame Image (FFI) light curves generated by the Eleanor pipeline.

tools.name: citlalicue
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for creating and manipulating stellar light curves
tools.detailed_description: A software package designed to create and manipulate stellar light curves, likely for simulation or preprocessing purposes in exoplanet or stellar variability studies.

tools.name: exotrending
tools.one_line_profile: Fast light curve detrending software for exoplanets
tools.detailed_description: A fast and easy-to-use software tool specifically designed for detrending light curves, a critical step in exoplanet detection and characterization.

tools.name: feets
tools.one_line_profile: Feature Extractor for Time Series
tools.detailed_description: A library for extracting features from time series data, specifically designed for astronomical light curves to aid in classification and analysis.

tools.name: everest
tools.one_line_profile: EPIC Variability Extraction and Removal for Exoplanet Science Targets
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for de-trending K2 light curves, using pixel level decorrelation to remove instrumental noise and improve photometric precision.

tools.name: starry_process
tools.one_line_profile: Interpretable Gaussian processes for stellar light curves
tools.detailed_description: A library that implements interpretable Gaussian processes specifically for modeling stellar light curves, allowing for the inference of surface features.

tools.name: DELightcurveSimulation
tools.one_line_profile: Emmanoulopoulos style lightcurve simulation
tools.detailed_description: A tool for simulating light curves using the Emmanoulopoulos et al. method, useful for generating synthetic data for testing analysis pipelines.

tools.name: astrolibpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python port of IDL astrolib
tools.detailed_description: A repository of astronomical codes converted from the IDL astrolib, providing various utility functions for astronomical data analysis.

tools.name: PyFITS
tools.one_line_profile: Library for reading and writing FITS files (Legacy)
tools.detailed_description: A library for reading and writing FITS (Flexible Image Transport System) files, the standard data format in astronomy. Although deprecated in favor of Astropy, it remains a foundational tool.

tools.name: astroimtools
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical Image Convenience Tools
tools.detailed_description: A package providing convenience tools for processing and analyzing astronomical images, including cutouts and statistics.

tools.name: gwcs
tools.one_line_profile: Generalized World Coordinate System
tools.detailed_description: A library for managing Generalized World Coordinate Systems (GWCS), providing tools for mapping pixel coordinates to world coordinates in a flexible way.

tools.name: imexam
tools.one_line_profile: Image examination and plotting tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for simple image examination and plotting, offering functionality similar to the classic IRAF imexamine task.

tools.name: jwql
tools.one_line_profile: James Webb Space Telescope Quicklook Application
tools.detailed_description: A web application and tool suite for monitoring the health and data quality of the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) instruments.

tools.name: stsynphot_refactor
tools.one_line_profile: Synthetic photometry using Astropy for HST and JWST
tools.detailed_description: A package for synthetic photometry specifically tailored for HST and JWST, utilizing the Astropy framework to simulate observations.

tools.name: synphot_refactor
tools.one_line_profile: Synthetic photometry using Astropy
tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose package for synthetic photometry using Astropy, allowing users to simulate photometric data from spectra and passbands.

tools.name: Optika
tools.one_line_profile: A Python library for simulating optical systems and ray tracing
tools.detailed_description: Optika is a Python library designed for simulating optical systems, offering capabilities similar to Zemax. It allows for the modeling of optical components, ray tracing, and analysis of optical performance, suitable for physics and astronomical instrumentation.

tools.name: ndcube
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-dimensional coordinate-aware array library for solar physics
tools.detailed_description: ndcube is a SunPy-affiliated package that provides a base class for handling multi-dimensional contiguous and non-contiguous coordinate-aware arrays. It is designed to handle complex scientific data cubes, particularly in solar physics, integrating data with World Coordinate System (WCS) information.

tools.name: SunPy
tools.one_line_profile: The community-developed open-source software library for solar physics
tools.detailed_description: SunPy is a comprehensive Python library for solar physics data analysis. It provides tools for querying and downloading data from solar missions, loading and visualizing images and time series, and performing coordinate transformations and physical calculations.

tools.name: sunraster
tools.one_line_profile: Tools to analyze spectral data from solar missions
tools.detailed_description: sunraster is a SunPy-affiliated package specifically designed for the analysis of spectral data (raster scans) from solar physics missions. It builds upon ndcube to provide specialized functionality for handling slit-spectrograph data.

tools.name: deepARTransit
tools.one_line_profile: LSTM-based library for interpolating and detrending transit light curves
tools.detailed_description: deepARTransit is a Python library that utilizes Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) neural networks to interpolate and detrend exoplanet transit light curves. It is designed to handle the noise and variability in photometric data to improve transit detection and characterization.

tools.name: pydl
tools.one_line_profile: Library of IDL astronomy routines converted to Python
tools.detailed_description: pydl implements Python replacements for common IDL (Interactive Data Language) routines used in astronomy. It facilitates the transition from IDL to Python for astronomers by providing familiar functionality for data processing and mathematical operations.
